Solar_Panel.name: Solar Panel
Solar_Panel.description: Captures solar energy to power the system.

physics_models.name: Power Generation
physics_models.coding_directives:
def calculate_power(efficiency, area, solar_irradiance):
    return efficiency * area * solar_irradiance
physics_models.python_code:
def calculate_power(efficiency, area, solar_irradiance):
    return efficiency * area * solar_irradiance
physics_models.coder_notes: Solar irradiance varies between 300 W/m² and 1000 W/m².
assumptions: Solar irradiance varies between 300 W/m² and 1000 W/m².

Solar_Panel.verification_plan: Test under varying solar irradiance conditions to ensure power output meets requirements.

Filter_Unit.name: Filter Unit

embodiment.description: Lightweight and compact hollow-fiber membrane for portability.

physics_models.name: Flow Rate
physics_models.coding_directives:
def calculate_flow_rate(volume, time):
    return volume / time
physics_models.python_code:
def calculate_flow_rate(volume, time):
    return volume / time
physics_models.coder_notes: Volume is measured in liters and time in hours.
assumptions: Volume is measured in liters and time in hours.

Filter_Unit.verification_plan: Test filtration efficiency and flow rate under various water quality conditions.

Battery.name: Battery
Battery.description: Stores energy for operation during low light conditions.

embodiment.description: Compact and lightweight lithium-ion battery for portability.

physics_models.name: Energy Storage
physics_models.coding_directives:
def calculate_energy(capacity, voltage):
    return capacity * voltage
physics_models.python_code:
def calculate_energy(capacity, voltage):
    return capacity * voltage

Battery.verification_plan: Test energy storage capacity and discharge rate under varying loads.

Control_Unit.name: Control Unit
Control_Unit.description: Manages system operations and user interface.

embodiment.description: Basic microcontroller for system control and monitoring.

physics_models.name: Processing Power
physics_models.coding_directives:
def calculate_processing_time(instructions, processing_power):
    return instructions / processing_power
physics_models.python_code:
def calculate_processing_time(instructions, processing_power):

physics_models.coder_notes: Instructions are measured in million instructions per second (MIPS).
assumptions: Instructions are measured in million instructions per second (MIPS).
